etymology.description: 又 ‘hand’ + 十 ‘(half of 竹) branch of bamboo’.
etymology.interpretation: A right hand with a bamboo piece evokes the idea of holding or branching off. The imagery broadened to senses like branch, support, and later served as a classifier for slender objects.

examples.chinese: 这条河有许多支流(這條河有許多支流)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tiáo hé yǒu xǔduō zhīliú.

examples.chinese: 这个项目有几个重要的分支(這個項目有幾個重要的分支)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège xiàngmù yǒu jǐ gè zhòngyào de fēnzhī.
examples.english: This project has several important branches.

examples.chinese: 我买了一支笔(我買了一支筆)。
